description: Get a Token from Azure AD

access_token.description: This is the requested access token. The app can use this token to authenticate to the sink resource.

client_id.description: This is the client_id specified in the request, if any.

resource.description: This is the app ID URI of the sink resource.

authority.description: This indicates the authority to request AAD tokens from. Defaults to the known authority of the identity to be used.

expires_on.description: This is the time when the access token expires. The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time. This value is used to determine the lifetime of cached tokens.

ext_expires_in.description: This indicates the extended lifetime of the token (in seconds).

token_type.description: This indicates the token type value.

expires_in.description: This is how long the access token is valid (in seconds).

not_before.description: This is the time when the access token becomes effective. The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.

api_version.description: This is the API version to use.

object_id.description: This is the object_id specified in the request, if any.

msi_res_id.description: This is the msi_res_id specified in the request, if any.

bypass_cache.description: If provided, the value must be 'true'. This indicates to the server that the token must be retrieved from Azure AD and cannot be retrieved from an internal cache.
